intro: Alkekengi officinarum var. officinarum, commonly known as the common red balloon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the genus Alkekengi in the family Violaceae, which includes other flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant produces striking, inflated, red or orange seed pods that resemble small balloons, which are a key feature in its botanical description. These pods contain seeds that are used in traditional medicine and as a food source in some cultures. The plant thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
